title: Love Is All Around
description: On the rebound from a busted relationship, Mary Richards relocates to Minneapolis, where she quickly finds a new apartment, an associate producer's job at WJM-TV, and new friends.

title: Today I am a Ma'am
description: Frustrated with their single status, Mary and Rhoda invite dates to a "little gathering" at Mary's apartment.

title: Bess, You Is My Daughter Now
description: Mary agrees to take care of Phyllis's precocious daughter for a few days.

title: Divorce Isn't Everything
description: Rhoda convinces Mary to join the "Better Luck Next Time Club," an organization for divorced people, so they can take advantage of its discounted charter flights to Paris.

title: Keep Your Guard Up
description: Mary helps out a luckless former pro-football player who wants to be WJM's new sportscaster.

title: Support Your Local Mother
description: Mary puts Rhoda's visiting mother up in her apartment when Rhoda refuses to see her.

title: Toulouse-Lautrec Is One of My Favorite Artists
description: Mary accepts a date with a very short visiting author.

title: The Snow Must Go On
description: Put in charge of the station's election coverage, Mary is put to the test when a blizzard completely suspends election results and the crew threatens to mutiny.

title: Bob and Rhoda and Teddy and Mary
description: Rhoda's new boyfriend takes an interest in Mary, and the newsroom preoccupies itself with the impending Teddy Awards.

title: Assistant Wanted, Female
description: Mary reluctantly hires Phyllis to be her assistant in the newsroom.

title: 1040 or Fight
description: Mary's income-tax returns are audited by an amorous IRS agent.

title: Anchorman Overboard
description: Mary reluctantly arranges for Ted to speak at Phyllis's women's club.

title: He's All Yours
description: Mary must deal with the amorous advances of WJM's obnoxious, and very young, new cameraman.

title: Christmas and the Hard-Luck Kid II
description: Mary is forced to work not only on Christmas Day but Christmas Eve, too.

title: Howard's Girl
description: Mary's budding romance with Paul Arnell hits a roadblock -- Paul's parents, who insist that Mary belongs with their favorite son, Howard.

title: Party Is Such Sweet Sorrow
description: Mary is offered a job to produce her own show at another television station.

title: Just a Lunch
description: A globe-trotting journalist returns to WJM and catches Mary's eye, but she can't see beyond the fact that he's still married.

title: Second Story Story
description: Mary's apartment is burglarized, twice.

title: We Closed in Minneapolis
description: Frustrated playwright Murray has his play accepted by the Twin Cities Playhouse, and Ted and Mary join the cast.

title: Hi!
description: In the hospital for a tonsillectomy, Mary must share a room with a very grumpy patient.

title: The Boss Isn't Coming to Dinner
description: Mary discovers the real reason Mr. Grant has been turning down her dinner invitations -- he and his wife have separated.

title: A Friend in Deed
description: A forgotten pal from summer camp turns up as WJM's new receptionist and wants to be Mary's best friend again.

title: Smokey the Bear Wants You
description: Rhoda's generous new boyfriend has no apparent source of income, and Mary grows suspicious.

title: The 45-Year-Old Man
description: To get Mr. Grant back his job, Mary pays a visit to the outrageous station owner, Wild Jack Monroe.

title: The Birds... and... um... Bess
description: Mary agrees to explain the "facts of life" to Phyllis's daughter, Bess.

title: I Am Curious Cooper
description: Lou breaks his "not fixing people up with Mike Cooper" rule and sets up Mary with his best friend. But there's no chemistry.

title: He's No Heavy... He's My Brother
description: Mary and Rhoda live to regret allowing a waiter arrange for their Mexican hotel accommodations when he asks them to deliver a mysterious package.

title: Room 223
description: Frustrated with her lack of progress at WJM, Mary decides to sharpen her skills with a class in television journalism. Naturally, she catches the teacher's eye.

title: A Girl's Best Mother Is Not Her Friend
description: Rhoda's visiting mother decides to become Rhoda's "friend."

title: Cover Boy
description: Ted receives a visit from his super-competitive brother, a male model.

title: Didn't You Used to Be... Wait... Don't Tell Me
description: Assuming that the relentless Howard Arnell won't be going, Mary decides to attend a high-school reunion, and Rhoda comes along.

title: Thoroughly Unmilitant Mary
description: The television newswriters union goes on strike, other guilds and unions follow, and Mary has to cross the picket line.

title: And Now, Sitting in for Ted Baxter
description: Not without reason, Ted is worried that his mandatory vacation might become a permanent one.

title: Don't Break the Chain
description: Mary conjures up a few men from her past when she reluctantly continues Mr. Grant's chain letter.

title: The Six-and-a-Half-Year Itch
description: Lou catches his favorite son-in-law at a movie theater with another woman.

title: Is a Friend in Need
description: Rhoda's not having much luck finding a new job, and Mary lies to her about an opening at WJM.

title: The Square-Shaped Room
description: Mary arranges for Rhoda to redecorate Mr. Grant's living room.

title: Ted Over Heels
description: Ted is in love, with the daughter of Chuckles the Clown.

title: The Five-Minute Dress
description: Mary's new love interest, an assistant to the governor, keeps breaking their dates.

title: Feeb
description: Mary feels so guilty for getting an incompetent waitress fired that she gets her a job in the newsroom.

title: The Slaughter Affair
description: Murray's been moonlighting to earn extra money for a special anniversary gift, but his lack of sleep is starting to affect his performance in the newsroom.

title: Baby Sit-Com
description: Mary's committed to watching Bess over the weekend, so when an old flame unexpectedly comes to town, she turns to an unlikely baby-sitter - Mr Grant.

title: More Than Neighbors
description: There's a vacant apartment in Mary's building, and Ted wants to move into it.

title: The Care and Feeding of Parents
description: Pressured by Phyllis, Mary reluctantly agrees to ask the publishing company in her office building to consider Bess's school composition for "Teen Topics' magazine.

title: Where There's Smoke, There's Rhoda
description: A friendship is put to the test when Rhoda temporarily moves in with Mary.

title: You Certainly Are a Big Boy
description: Mary knew the architect she's interested in had a son, but she didn't know the son's all grown up.

title: Some of My Best Friends Are Rhoda
description: Mary's new friend, Joanne, is attractive, successful, polished...but she doesn't seem to take to Rhoda.

title: His Two Right Arms
description: Mary helps the staff of a incompetent councilman prepare for his appearance on WJM's "Face the People" show.

title: The Good-Time News
description: Mary and Mr. Grant stand off over her salary and over WJM's new, informal news format -- she's for it, he's not.

title: What Is Mary Richards Really Like?
description: Mary may live to regret agreeing to be interviewed by a hypercritical newspaper columnist.

title: Who's in Charge Here?
description: When Lou is promoted to program manager, Mary has to decide whether she wants to be promoted to producer.

title: Enter Rhoda's Parents
description: Her parents' visit takes a left turn when Rhoda's suspicious mother walks out on her father.

title: It's Whether You Win or Lose
description: Murray doesn't seem interested in joining the poker game that Mary's arranging for the guys.

title: Rhoda the Beautiful
description: A slimmed-down Rhoda is selected as a contestant for her store's beauty contest, but she's having trouble accepting her new attractive self.

title: Just Around the Corner
description: Mary finds herself to be less than overjoyed about her parents' moving to Minneapolis.

title: But Seriously, Folks
description: Mary tries to be supportive when her new boyfriend quits his job writing for Chuckles the Clown.

title: Farmer Ted and the News
description: Ted may have outsmarted Lou when he convinces him to strike the clause from his contract that forbids him from doing other work, things like movies and Broadway. And cheesy commercials.

title: Have I Found a Guy for You
description: Mary's thinks her friends the Fosters are the perfect couple. When they split up, Mary wonders what the rules are about dating Jack Foster.

title: You've Got a Friend
description: When Mary decides that her retired father needs a friend, she tries to pair him up with Mr. Grant.

title: It Was Fascination, I Know
description: Mary's latest admirer is younger than she is...a lot, lot younger. And Mary must find a way to let him down gently.

title: Operation: Lou
description: With Lou in the hospital, Mary and Murray are at odds in the newsroom; meanwhile, Ted's thoughtful behavior has Lou reconsidering his opinion of the buffoonish anchorman.

title: Rhoda Morgenstern: Minneapolis to New York
description: Rhoda is offered a job at Bloomingdale's in New York City, and much to Mary's surprise, she accepts it.

title: The Courtship of Mary's Father's Daughter
description: Mary runs into her old journalism teacher, and boyfriend, Dan Whitfield. Things get complicated when Mary and Rhoda show up at his engagement party.

title: Lou's Place
description: Lou buys a friendly little bar, a lifelong dream. He comes to realize, though, that he might not have the right personality to be a friendly little-bar owner.

title: My Brother's Keeper
description: Phyllis's beloved brother Ben comes to town for a visit and, much to her dismay, hits it off not with Mary but with Rhoda.

title: The Georgette Story
description: Mary and Rhoda give Georgette some sisterly advice when Ted starts taking her for granted.

title: Romeo and Mary
description: One rotten date turns into extended agony and embarrassment for Mary when the boorish clown just won't give up.

title: What Do You Do When the Boss Says 'I Love You'
description: WJM has yet another new program director, but this time it's a woman. And she's got a crush on Lou.

title: Murray Faces Life
description: Murray falls into a major funk when an old schoolmate of his wins the Pulitzer Prize. His workmates, even Ted, try to make him appreciate the life he has.

title: Remembrance of Things Past
description: The one man capable of breaking Mary's heart shows up in Minneapolis, and Mary is very reluctant to see him.

title: Put on a Happy Face
description: A stained dress, a sprained foot, a bad cold, and a hair bump -- what else is going to wrong for Mary before the annual Teddy Awards banquet?

title: Mary Richards and the Incredible Plant Lady
description: Mary lends money to Rhoda so she can open a plant store, but when the store takes off, Rhoda doesn't seem anxious about paying the money back.

title: The Lars Affair
description: Phyllis struggles to accept the idea that her husband, Lars, might be having an affair with the saccharine Sue Ann Nivens, WJM's Happy Homemaker.

title: Angels in the Snow
description: Mary thinks there's nothing wrong about dating a younger man, but her friends and co-workers think otherwise.

title: Rhoda's Sister Gets Married
description: When Rhoda takes Mary along to her younger sister's wedding in New York, both of them have to cope with Rhoda's overbearing parents.

title: The Lou and Edie Story
description: The newsroom rallies around Lou when he tells them about his troubles at home -- he and his wife are seeing a marriage counselor.

title: Hi There, Sports Fans
description: Mary asks for more responsibility and Mr. Grant gives it to her: hire a new sportscaster, and fire the old one.

title: Father's Day
description: Ted's long-lost father has come to Minneaoplis, and Ted doesn't want to see him.

title: Son of 'But Seriously, Folks'
description: When Mary's old beau Wes Callison takes a job in WJM's newsroom, she worries that his feelings for her will interfere with their jobs. And they do.

title: Lou's First Date
description: Mary finds Lou a date for the broadcasters' dinner, but she's not anything like what Lou was expecting.

title: Love Blooms at Hemples
description: Mary cautions Rhoda about taking her new relationship too fast. But Rhoda's not inclined to listen to advice.

title: The Dinner Party
description: It's time for another one of Mary's dinner parties. She has six chairs at her dining-room table and exactly six portions of veal Prince Orloff.

title: Just Friends
description: Sent by Mr. Grant on a surveillance mission, Mary returns from his estranged wife's apartment with a dinner invitation for him.

title: We Want Baxter
description: Against everyone's better judgment, Phyllis taps Ted Baxter to run in the city council primary.

title: I Gave at the Office
description: Murray remains blind to his daughter's shortcomings when she's hired to help out in the newsroom.

title: Almost a Nun's Story
description: Frustrated by Ted's errant ways, Georgette decides to live it up. And then she decides to become a nun.

title: Happy Birthday, Lou!
description: Worried that Mr Grant will be alone on his first birthday separated from his wife, Mary throws together a surprise party for him.

title: WJM Tries Harder
description: Mary starts dating the anchorman from Minneapolis's top-rated news station and suddenly finds herself to be frustrated with her own humble, ratings-dwelling WJM.

title: Cottage for Sale
description: Phyllis gets her real-estate license and her first victim is Mr. Grant. She convinces him to sell his house.

title: The Co-Producers
description: The good news: Mary and Rhoda get to co-produce WJM's new Sunday afternoon talk show. The bad news: Ted Baxter and Sue Ann Nivens are the stars.

title: Best of Enemies
description: When Rhoda lets out of one Mary's secrets, and refuses to apologize, it leads to the first serious test of their friendship.

title: Better Late... That's a Pun... Than Never
description: Working into the early morning, and delirious, Mary and Rhoda take some artistic liberties updating WJM's obituaries, and, when one of them is read on the air, there are serious consequences for Mary.

title: Ted Baxter Meets Walter Cronkite
description: Ted launches an expensive publicity campaign in his never-ending quest to win a Teddy award.

title: Lou's Second Date
description: There are second and third dates when Rhoda fills-in for an ailing Mary as Mr. Grant's dinner companion. But will the fun Rhoda and Lou are having be spoiled by gossip?

title: Two Wrongs Don't Make a Writer
description: Mary is less than thrilled when Ted decides to join her creative writing class.

title: I Was a Single for WJM
description: Mary must take over the research for WJM's feature story on a new singles bar when Murray's wife objects to his doing it.

title: Will Mary Richards Go to Jail?
description: Mary refuses to name a source for her news story and ends up in jail.

title: Not Just Another Pretty Face
description: Mary begins to feels that her attraction to her current beau is completely superficial.

title: You Sometimes Hurt the One You Hate
description: When Ted endorses a candidate on the air, Lou gets mad and throws him out. After Lou feels what he did was wrong, Ted takes advantage of him.

title: Lou and That Woman
description: Lou's prospective new girlfriend is a lounge singer with a shady past.

title: The Outsider
description: The consultant hired to change the WJM News makes changes that seem to annoy everyone.

title: I Love a Piano
description: Murray thinks about having an affair with a woman who is offering an old piano for sale.

title: A New Sue Ann
description: A fan of Sue Ann's joins the show and then starts to push her out ala All About Eve.

title: Menage-a-Phyllis
description: A man that Phyllis is seeing platonicly starts to show an attraction for Mary.

title: Not a Christmas Story
description: Everyone is getting on each others nerves when they are trapped in the newsroom by a snowstorm.

title: What Are Friends For?
description: At a convention together Mary finds out that Sue Ann is much lonelier than she appears to be.

title: A Boy's Best Friend
description: Ted is against his mother living with her boyfriend instead of marrying him.

title: A Son for Murray
description: With three daughters, Murray's wife doesn't want to have another baby so they decide to adopt a son.

title: Neighbors
description: Lou moves into Rhoda's old apartment in Mary's building.

title: A Girl Like Mary
description: When Lou wants a female newscaster in the mold of Mary Richards, Mary tries out for the job.

title: An Affair to Forget
description: Ted convinces the newsroom that he is having an affair with Mary. No one believes her when she tries to deny it and then she has to face Georgette.

title: Mary Richards: Producer
description: Mary doesn't feel that she has earned the title of producer until she produces the Six O'clock News by herself.

title: The System
description: Ted invents a system for the weekly football pool that works and Lou goes in with him until the Superbowl.

title: Phyllis Whips Inflation
description: When Phyliss goes to look for a job she finds that she has no current skills.

title: The Shame of the Cities
description: Lou launches a major investigation into a city councilman and finds that he is not corrupt.

title: Marriage Minneapolis Style
description: Ted asks Georgette to marry him and then he takes it back.

title: You Try to Be a Nice Guy
description: Mary helps a street girl she met in prison to go straight.

title: You Can't Lose 'em All
description: Lou wins an award that he originally ridiculed.

title: Ted Baxter's Famous Broadcasters' School
description: After a conman promises to start a broadcasting school for Ted and swindles him out of his money, the newsroom staff help Ted out.

title: Anyone Who Hates Kids and Dogs
description: The son of Mary's new boyfriend is a royal brat.

title: Edie Gets Married
description: Lou has to face the fact that is ex-wife Edie is getting married.

title: Mary Moves Out
description: Looking for a change in her life, Mary moves to another apartment.

title: Mary's Father
description: While Mary is working with a priest, he announces that he is leaving the priesthood. Is it because of Mary?

title: Murray in Love
description: Murray wants to confess to Mary that he loves her.

title: Ted's Moment of Glory
description: Ted is tempted with an offer to host a game show in New York City. Do Mary and Lou really want to see him go?

title: Mary's Aunt
description: Mary's Aunt Flo a hard-nosed famous newswoman flies into town and rubs Lou the wrong way.

title: Chuckles Bites the Dust
description: Mary thinks that the death of Chuckles the Clown is nothing to laugh about--until she attends the funeral.

title: Mary's Delinquent
description: Mary adopts a teen-aged shoplifter as a little sister. Sue Ann does the same adopting a black teenager which influences her in a major way.

title: Ted's Wedding
description: Ted and Georgette get married in Mary's apartment on an hour's notice.

title: Lou Douses an Old Flame
description: Lou runs into a woman who sent him a "Dear John" letter during World War II.

title: Mary Richards Falls in Love
description: Mary is in love and wants to hear the same from her boyfriend.

title: Ted's Tax Refund
description: Ted Baxter is being audited by the I.R.S.

title: The Happy Homemaker Takes Lou Home
description: Mary sets up a blind date for Lou with Sue Ann Nivens.

title: One Boyfriend Too Many
description: Mary has to choose between her current boyfriend and an old flame that returns to town.

title: What Do You Want to Do When You Produce?
description: Murray regrets become producer of the Happy Homemaker Show due to the menial tasks that Sue Ann forces onto him.

title: Not with My Wife, I Don't
description: Ted won't see a marriage counselor unless Lou goes with him.

title: The Seminar
description: At a seminar in Washington Lou tries to impress Mary with all his former contacts that just don't seem to exist anymore. Betty Ford makes a cameo.

title: Once I Had a Secret Love
description: Lou spends the night with Sue Ann and Mary can't keep the secret.

title: Menage-a-Lou
description: Lou is putout when his old girlfriend shows up at Mary's party with a date. He then quickly asks out Mary's neighbor Paula.

title: Murray Takes a Stand
description: Murray gets fired when he stands up to the policies of the new station owner.

title: Mary's Aunt Returns
description: Mary is at odds with Lou over a public television documentary.

title: A Reliable Source
description: Mary threatens an old friend with revealing a secret when he decides to run for office.

title: Sue Ann Falls in Love
description: Sue Ann falls in love with a jerk.

title: Ted and the Kid
description: Ted and Georgette adopted after they are told they can't have children. Then Georgette makes a startling announcement.

title: Mary Midwife
description: Georgette gives birth at Mary's apartment with Lou and Mary attending. Ted and Georgette have a little girl named Mary Lou, the most exciting thing to ever happen in Mary's bedroom according to Sue Ann.

title: Mary the Writer
description: Mary tries to sell an article she wrote to a magazine and is not happy with the feedback she receives from Lou.

title: Sue Ann's Sister
description: Sue Ann's sister gets an offer to do a rival cooking show in Minneapolis.

title: What's Wrong with Swimming?
description: Mary's choice for the new sportscaster is a former swimmer who only reports on swimming events. Lou insists that she fire her.

title: Ted's Change of Heart
description: After a heart attack, Ted discovers how precious life is.

title: One Producer Too Many
description: Lou makes Murray a co-producer after he gets an offer from another station. Mary is not happy about this situation.

title: My Son, the Genius
description: Ted and Georgette find out that their son is a genius who tries to take advantage of Ted.

title: Mary Gets a Lawyer
description: Mary's lawyer is taken with her when he is defending her on a contempt charge.

title: Lou Proposes
description: Lou is thinking of proposing to Mary's hard-nosed newswoman Aunt Flo.

title: Murray Can't Lose
description: The word is out that Murray is a sure thing to win at this year's Teddy awards.

title: Mary's Insomnia
description: Lou is concerned about Mary's possible addiction to sleeping pills.

title: Ted's Temptation
description: An attractive journalist tries to seduce Ted at a convention.

title: Look at Us, We're Walking
description: The newsroom staff threatens to quit if there are not any pay raises.

title: The Critic
description: The new Six Oclock News critic starts attacking the residents of Minneapolis.

title: Lou's Army Reunion
description: Lou wants to return a favor to an old Army buddy, but balks when he asks for a date with Mary.

title: The Ted and Georgette Show
description: Ted and Georgette do a show that becomes a hit, but Georgette would rather stay at home taking care of her family.

title: Sue Ann Gets the Ax
description: After Sue Ann Niven's Happy Homemaker show is canceled she gets a job in the newsroom.

title: Hail the Conquering Gordy
description: Gordy the former WJM weatherman now a network star returns and Ted hopes for a job.

title: Mary and the Sexagenarian
description: Without knowing it, Mary accepts a date from Murray's father.

title: Murray Ghosts for Ted
description: Ted refuses to give Murray credit after an article he ghost writes for Ted becomes popular.

title: Mary's Three Husbands
description: After a long day Lou, Murray and Ted have a drink and fantasize what it would be like to be married to Mary.

title: Mary's Big Party
description: Mary hopes that finally she'll have one dinner party that is not a disaster. Tonight Johnny Carson is going to make an appearance and then the lights go out.

title: Lou Dates Mary
description: Mary asks Lou out for a date after Georgette suggests it.

title: The Last Show
description: In the upside world of WJM, there's a shake up in the newsroom and everybody but Ted gets fired including Mary who is left to turn out the lights.
